Summary: The world is changing. Leaders often need to change the direction, culture, or strategy of their organizations. But they can't do it alone. They need their staff and teams 100% behind them. Building that shared sense of purpose and engagement is often the biggest challenge, and the single-most important ingredient for success. When asked, most CEOs and Executive Directors will tell you that they believe in the power of their people (board, staff, volunteers, investors, and donors). But for those who are searching for ever-increasing ways to unlock the power of their stakeholders, let's work together. Q: Need to change your culture so that staff take on more ownership?  A: We'll engage them in finding solutions.  Q: Have a board who wants to get to the next level of functionality, but doesn't know how?  A: We'll get them unstuck by providing them with structure to gain insights, bond as a team, and map out a plan of attack, along with accountability measures.  Q: Are your stakeholders moving in different directions?  A: We will map out a transparent process that culminates with a compelling mission and vision statement, as well as a process to ensure that we receive tangible outcomes.  A: Or we might create a strategic planning process and six-year living, breathing strategic plan, but only if the key players who must executive the plan take ownership of the outcomes, as a critical part of our work together.  A: Or let's embark on a new initiative to become a Center of Excellence. A: Or launch a company-wide Innovation & Business Development Initiative. A: Or prepare for and launch a two-day retreat for top customers or donors to get their feedback, and increase their engagement.  I'll tap my skills as a business consultant (Stanford MBA), stand-up comedian (opened for Joan Rivers), and former legislator (four elected terms to the Vermont Legislature), with more than two decades of strengthening dozens of organizations and coaching leaders.  We will facilitate change together, in a sustainable way that empowers your entire organization. And yes, we will also have fun.
Title: Partner for Organizational Change | President | Founder

Title: Founder & CEO

Summary: I help people sell because I know the real reason why people buy.  And it all starts with understanding one moment. The one moment that matters.  In sales, we have to connect with another human being and persuade that person to say “yes.” Yes. We see the world the same way.  Yes, We share a belief in how things can change for the better.  Yes. I trust you and I want to start a relationship with you.  This is the moment. And yet, each time we step into that ring and summon up the courage to persuade, we often default to old patterns of persuasion. As a result, we leave that moment to chance. And we leave a secret weapon to persuasion locked away in its case. This secret weapon is the oldest trick in our human playbook.  It’s the shortcut that a select few know about. It’s a skill we were all born with. It’s the mind hack that sidesteps the fortress of objections.  Storytelling and its ability to quickly establish trust is the most proven, trusted and successful way to get anyone to say “yes.” Learn how to be a better storyteller in that moment, and you will learn how to become more persuasive.
Title: Founder and  Chief Storyteller

Summary: We are Owner's representatives…the Owner's eyes and ears on major capital projects. We operate on the belief that capital projects are much more that just an assembly of parts and processes.  From the Owner's perspective, a capital project exists to support the core mission of the organization. We believe that everything that goes into the planning and construction of any capital project should reflect the values and vision of the organization for which it is being built.   For contractors, capital projects provide limitless opportunities: To participate fully in local economies; To provide meaningful employment; To build enduring, sustainable structures; To support and advance the art, science, and skill of the trades; To participate, as active partners, in the missions of vital institutions; To share knowledge and experience. In short, we believe that all capital projects are inherently positive endeavors:  They are statements of commitment of an organization to its core mission.

Summary: Business owners learn by doing. My education began with my first company, a house painting business when I was in high school. I wasn’t old enough to drive so I found a partner with a driver’s license and we made 6X the minimum wage for two summers.  In college, I founded University Consultants to help small companies automate business processes with computers. This was my first experience working with business owners to solve real problems and I was hooked on consulting forever. I started my first “real” company, The Kodiak Group, at 30. We provided business operations and eCommerce consulting services to Fortune 500 clients throughout North America. We doubled in size every year and were profitable every quarter. Five years later, we sold the company to a venture capital-backed, pre-IPO roll-up. We rode out the IPO during the Internet boom years. After the bubble burst, we bought our company back in a leveraged management buyout and then sold it again after the economy recovered.  A career in small business ownership and big business consulting has given me unique perspectives on launching, acquiring, growing, exiting and integrating businesses. I’ve advised hundreds of business owners and executives in large and small companies in a wide range of industries, from industrial products and B2B services to healthcare and consumer products.  I’ve learned how important it is for business leaders to have experienced, trusted advisors to provide ideas and validation, especially when big decisions have to be made. Venture 7 Advisors provides exactly that kind of support - practical advice to help business owners build and exit their companies with confidence. It’s the best job I’ve ever had.

Summary: Bridge Builder ♾ Change Maker ♾ Healing Navigator ♾ Web Weaver  Hi! I’m Rae 💫 Founder of EmpowR 💫 a healing & social justice enterprise centered in co-creating personal and cultural transformation, inspired by navigating my own cancer and trauma healing journey. ✅ I offer equity and inclusion facilitation, healing navigation, culture change services, intuitive counsel, and educational programs to empower people, organizations, and movements to affect heart-centered change. ✅ The EmpowR container provides vision, guidance, and approaches for how we can collectively build a more inclusive, just, and compassionate society.  ✅ I actively train both professionally and intuitively in healing modalities including meditation and embodiment practices, vocal and cultural somatics, council facilitation, Reiki, Earth-based healing and spirituality, and herbalism.  ✅ My career background spans strategic planning, organizational communication and marketing, grassroots organizing, human behavior and trend examination, systems thinking, and root cause analysis.  ✅ I hold expertise in social change and collective impact, sustainable economic development, food systems, holistic health, nonprofit organizations, private sector business, and government; also serving as the co-founder of the Rooted in Vermont movement.  ✅ I serve on the Vermont Businesses for Social Responsibility (VBSR) board of directors and executive committee, Vermonters Taking Action Against Cancer steering committee, Vermont Farm to Plate health cross-cutting team, and Vermont Council on Rural Development’s Leadership Network. ✅ My partner and I steward and regenerate land at the Forest Magic Healing Sanctuary in Plainfield, Vermont, where we hold space for healing retreats and events as well as cultivate organic and wild medicinal plant harvest and medicine making.  ✅ I’m also is also a singer and songwriter, creating downtempo music with the Hygge Den music collective. 🌈 I approach change making as a co-creator and am always interested in building relationships with collaborators and co-conspirators interested in sparking magic, building bridges, weaving webs, and transforming culture collectively to build a more unified world…together! 🌈🌈🌈
Title: Founder

Summary: “You have to put those hard times on the compost pile, so they will fertilize your next season of growth!” Those words may have come from a wise grandfather (and one was a farmer) but they’re mine. I’ve certainly had an interesting path: learning customer service at my father’s grocery store, hippie homesteader, furniture maker, expert ski boot fitter, and windsurfing instructor. Earned a master’s in psychology and was a member of a mobile crisis team. International business dude. Author of 2 books and gigging musician.  Now I work with small to medium-sized businesses to help them achieve better results and deeper satisfaction in my 19th year at Business Culture Consultants.  That's just the professional. The idyllic world of my 20’s was shattered by the sudden death of a neighbor. The thriving career of my 30’s blown apart by the tragic loss of my brother-in-law in a terrorist event. Finally, dealing with my “world-class substance abuse” patterns. Relationship crash-and-burn, stressful family stuff – you’ve likely experienced parallel events. As a mentor said, “If you lived your life backward it would make total sense.” Agreed! So how does this inform me and guide me in what I do now? First, I have empathy for how everyone is on a path of growth. I strive to be curious rather than judgmental. Second, while I’m a Vermont Licensed Psychologist-Masters I don’t diagnose and treat. It’s just a handy tool to have in my work.  Third, by being a Certified B Corp company I believe business should be a force for good, using a multiple bottom-line approach.  And I’ve become increasingly committed as a privileged white guy to support racial justice, gender equity, and a prosperous economy for all. Life is good, and life's been good to me, even though it seemed dark and confusing at times. But something larger prevails – a Mr. Lennon quote says it all: “Limitless undying love, which shines around me like a million suns, it calls me on and on across the universe.”
Title: Founder | Chief Effectiveness Officer | Business Culture Consultant | B Corp Expert

Summary: Steve Forbes, President and CEO, Forbes Inc. and former presidential candidate, says the need for financial literacy is imperative. But yet, I find that the lack of financial literacy is a common occurrence. When people understand how to manage their finances, closely held belief systems, which may not be true, are often replaced with facts. How money works is not complicated, nor does investing require unnecessary risk. The adage, no risk, no reward, is not always true.  There are many ways to increase a person’s financial potential while significantly reducing their exposure to risk. One way, the easiest way, in my opinion, is to identify how inefficiencies can create deficits. Simply recouping inefficiencies, in essence giving money back to themselves, it’s possible for people to achieve greater financial success, potentially even exceeding their goals with little to no additional out-of-pocket cost or risk.  It’s a holistic approach to managing and growing assets. Once people understand how each piece of the puzzle works, it’s easy to integrate disparate parts into a cohesive and flexible plan. It’s an imperative that YOU understand the financial implication of each move before YOU make it. Most people work 40 to 50 years and need money throughout their life while trying to save for retirement. In my experience, these same people are often dismayed at how little they saved.  Many of my clients choose to work with me to follow this process. They are taught to evaluate the guidance I provide and seek transparency in their financial choices, enabling them to make the right decisions.  The educational process is a means to an end. Financial literacy is ultimately about YOU. That you should be part of the process of managing your money. You should understand who’s got your money, where it is, and how it’s doing. Too often people just abdicate control.  I would love to meet with you to tell you more about the process. Feel free to call, email or message me.

Summary: How to deliver capital into the hands of risk taking entrepreneurs who can make real change within our Vermont economy has been my focus for 25 years.  The Vermont Community Loan Fund (VCLF) is a dynamic nonprofit Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) that works to accomplish this goal.  We focus on businesses and programs that help lower-income Vermonters access safe, affordable homes, quality jobs, child care and essential community services.  Since making our first loan back in the spring of 1988, the Loan Fund has made over 1000 distinct loans totaling over $100 million that created or retained jobs for 4,000 Vermonters, child care slots for 3,500 children, built or rehabilitated 3,500 affordable homes and financed community organizations serving hundreds of thousands of Vermonters.  VCLF also provides an investment opportunity for Vermonters who want to have a social and local impact with their money. Over 450 investors have lent VCLF $30 million in capital. These investors provide the fuel for our loan programs and in return receive a financial return and know that their money is having real impact in Vermont.

Summary: Marketing, communications, design, business... I find it all fascinating. The most fun part for me is diving deep into an organization to learn what they do, how they do it, where they want to go, how to best improve upon it and how to best communicate it to the world. Building the right solutions is challenging and never the same for any two organizations. The process can be seen by some as intrusive, nosey, unnecessary. Organizations, especially smaller ones, hold their business close to their chest, protecting it from being whisked away by another to build to the levels of what they have always envisioned. But to do my job best, it just can't be approached this way. I prefer to be thought of as a partner and ally. Those that agree, well we get to really see fantastic things happen. The whole process is simply a blast. I do love what I do! After many years of photography, design and business ownership, I am now partners with Margaret Donovan at Temblor Creative Group. Third - it all comes down to relationships, and relationships begin by sharing information. I’ve been part of small businesses and multi-billion-dollar, global entities. I’ve led international marketing teams and I have been the marketing team. Summary: Opportunity doesn’t knock. It’s created. In my 20+ years as a business owner and graphics installation expert, if there’s anything I’ve learned, it’s that opportunity is where you seek it. Keeping an eye on what’s new, what works and what doesn’t means that I’ve never hesitated to respond to rapidly changing market needs, learn the most cutting edge technology, and reinvent myself and my business as times called for it. —I turned a 100-year-old business on the brink of closing to stable profitability and 7-figure revenues by slashing outdated services and leveraging key trends —Demand for graphics on non-traditional media like auto wraps. Ours was one of the few firms that tapped niche B2B markets like OEM, retail and offices.   —I was of the first to own an SLR digital camera in Vermont and launch a digital photo studio at premier pre-press company.  —Where other school and event photography firms continue to wait for photos, I built Instant Images, LLC from scratch, transforming the local market with digital technology. Customers leave the event with photos in hand, a service offered by no other in my region. My other primary takeaway: You can’t knock trust.  It trumps everything else, whether dealing with team, client or supplier relationships. The focus has to be on quality, to build and maintain that trust. —Taking over an OEM market account, Bombardier Transportation, where the previous supplier had failed, I restored faith through meticulous trouble-shooting and testing, innovating the best graphic installation methods for 300+ double-decker trains. —Earning preferred supplier status for 21-site healthcare client remodel, my team created files and installed 300+ feet of graphics in just a few days. I welcome the chance to discuss how bringing an eye for opportunity, built on a foundation of quality and trust, can help your racing, graphics, or educational organization meet its most pressing challenges. 	 - Doug Bergstrom, douglas.bergstrom@gmail.com

Summary: The Human Resources Institute (also known as www.healthyculture.com and www.healthyculturenow.com) was founded by my father, Robert Allen, in the 1960's to assist businesses, government agencies, educational institutions and health care institutions in their efforts to create healthier and more productive cultural environments. Since my father's death in 1987, my focus has been on empowering others to create the cultural environments they want and need. Over the past 40 plus years, I have assisted several hundred organizations in their culture change efforts. I’ve served as an editor of the American Journal of Health Promotion and authored more than 50 books, journal articles and training manuals on leadership, household wellness, peer support, social climate, cultural analysis, organizational purpose, and systematic culture change. I’ve trained over 500 human resources and wellness professionals to be effective Culture Coaches. During 2020, I collaborated with Richard Safeer, MD, Chief Medical Director, Employee Health and Well-being at Johns Hopkins Medicine and Ewa Stelmasiak, MS, MSc, founder and owner of the Wellness Institute. We recorded over 160 HealthyCultureNow podcast episodes about creating cultures of well-being. The podcast and associated training has three audiences: (1) human resources and well-being professionals, (2) executives and middle-managers, and (3) employees and other individual VIPs. I see the toolkit as a valuable addition to current worksite wellness and health promotion programs.  My goal this year is to use this toolkit to empower over 100 companies to build cultures of well-being. We will be adding episodes that feature conversations with individuals engaged in creating supportive cultural environments. Further information about this initiative is available at www.healthyculturenow.com. I recently created the Healthy Culture Research and Education Fund. Although I am pleased that the vast majority of community and business leaders appreciate the importance of culture, I am confident that this research will add to our understanding of how to create supportive cultural environments.
Title: President, HealthyCultureNow, LLC, a podcast and training company

Summary: It is a type of acupuncture that involves sticking needles or acupontoscopes at specific points in the outer ear in order to manage certain physical, mental or emotional conditions. It’s believed that there are over 200 acupuncture points on the outer ear, with each named after a particular area of the human anatomy. When the acupuncture point is touched, it triggers an electrical impulse from the ear via the brain to the part of the body being treated.

Summary: EXPERTISE FROM A 7th GENERATION VERMONTER & VERMONT LAND BROKER My love for land fascinates and drives me.  I was raised on rural Vermont land, while my family logged, produced maple syrup, dairy farmed (for 9 generations!), and my family and I raised Christmas trees on 65 acres in the central part of the state. The decades of my involvement in realizing the environmentally sensitive nature on which Vermont farms, homes, estates, or commercial operations are built is – quite simply – in my DNA. From the types of soils in the fields to determining if there are sugar maples in the woods, to ensuring that logging and clearing are done responsibly, I can help you with these considerations and so much more.  I can also: • recommend where you should access your property • provide advice on how to construct your road appropriately • tell you how to orient your new home to maximize views and available sunlight • assess whether a pond area is possible to make your property even more desirable A LAND SPECIALIST MAKES ALL THE DIFFERENCE TO FIND THE RIGHT PROPERTY FOR YOU You want to buy a parcel of land that will be the right fit for you and your family. A bonus might be to add value to your investment by discovering what other natural assets already exist to enhance that investment.  Essentially, I want to help you with your Vermont land real estate purchase to build lasting memories in a beautiful place, which inspires and comforts you. A special place for you to call home. I look forward to connecting with you here on LinkedIn or by contacting me at: Email: Dave.Jamieson@Raveis.com Phone: 802-522-6702 Website: vermontlandcompany.com

Summary: Michelle Reina, PhD is Co-founder and Chief Trust Building Officer of Reina Trust Building®. She is an internationally sought after trust building consultant, speaker, and executive coach. Michelle began trust work in 1991 and is considered a pioneer in the field of organizational trust. She has a unique ability to understand the needs of leaders and their organizations, and to apply trust building principles to ensure they are met. Through her revolutionary work, research, and practice she helps integrate trust building behaviors into strategic organizational initiatives to achieve business results and transform cultures. Reina’s mission: live, build, and teach models of trust, healing, and renewal to create high-trust cultures. Together with her husband, Dennis Reina, PhD, she co-authored the award-winning, best-selling books Trust and Betrayal in the Workplace: Building Effective Relationships in Your Organization, 3rd ed. and Rebuilding Trust in the Workplace: Seven Steps to Renew Confidence, Commitment and Energy.  Michelle has published numerous articles appearing in the Wall Street Journal, Forbes, New York Times, and Harvard Business Management Update. She has appeared on CNN, CNBC and a variety of radio shows. She has received several leadership awards, including the Strategic Leadership Award by the World HRD Congress. Michelle has worked in-person and virtually with local and global leaders and teams inside 250 organizations, on every continent, and in a great variety of sectors. A particularly satisfying part of her work is how clients integrate trust building concepts into all aspects of life. Specialties: Trust Assessment, Trust Building, Executive Coaching, Organizational Culture, Teamwork, Change Management, Employee Engagement, Leadership Effectiveness, and Capability Transfer to Leaders
Title: Chief Trust Building® Officer | Founder

Summary: Congleton Service is the leading full-service Land Rover repair and restoration facility in North America. No matter which Land Rover you drive, Congleton Service can expertly repair your vehicle. We also offer an extensive collection of quality and hard-to-find Land Rover parts on our web store, all vetted by our team of technicians. Our in-house engineer is also creating direct-fit replicas of parts that are no longer available from Land Rover. Our proprietary Congleton Service parts are even more durable than the originals they are replacing.  At Congleton Service, we believe in originality and evolutionary improvement. While those two things are seemingly in conflict with each other, they’ve kept us firmly on the course we intended. We use the words above to decide what improvements should be made and what modifications would destroy the soul of the truck and the long-term value of our restorations. We improve these trucks for performance, reliability, safety, and comfort, but we won’t insult the men who designed them and built them by hand many years ago. We think the boys in Solihull would have figured out how to rust-proof the trucks, so we do it. We don’t think they’d bolt in Chevrolet/Corvette LS crate engines, so we don’t do that. We do hand-build Rover V8s that are more reliable than the originals and much more powerful because we think they would have continued improving the engine as they’d been doing for decades. There’s a place for highly-modified vehicles and we’ve owned more than our share… it’s just not what we do here. These are the world’s most iconic SUVs, rebuilt by hand and with a lot of pride in Colchester, Vermont.  Stop by www.congletonservice.com to learn more. And be sure to follow us on Instagram and Facebook at @congletonservice.

Summary: Sharon has been an events planner and marketing specialiist for over 25 years, first as the Events and Marketing Coordinator for the City of East Lansing, Michigan and then Assistant Director of Special Programs for Michigan State University's Alumni Association. In April 2010, Sharon began her own business, SharonT Events, LLC.  Since that time, she has provided events planning, fundraising, marketing and promotional services for the Burlington Chamber Orchestra; Central Vermont Chamber Music Festival; Champlain Valley Folk Festival; Community Health Center of Burlington; Eastern States Exposition (Big E); Full Circle Festival; Helen Day Art Center; Lake Champlain Maritime Festival; North End Studios; South End Art Hop; Stowe Wine and Food Classic; Vermont International Festival; and Young Tradition Vermont.  Sharon served in a temporary capacity coordinating May Commencement and Presidential Events at the University of Vermont in 2013.  In 2014, she served as logistics coordinator for the Full Circle Festival and Vermont Employee Ownership Conference and Marketing/PR Director for Girls Nite Out Productions. Presently she is serving as Operations Manager for the Burlington Chamber Orchestra; Marketing Coordinator for Young Tradition Vermont; Music Manager for the Vermont Building at The Big E (Eastern States Exposition) and Sales Mission Coordinator for the Vermont Convention Bureau.  She is on the faculty of the Stiller School of Business at Champlain College.

Summary: Great to meet you. How can I help? Connections and relationships are everything, they always have been and always will be. Even in these digital spaces fast times there is someone behind the link or the picture. Let's find out what we can do to contribute to each other.  So who am I? I've been in sales, marketing, and business growth about 26yrs now. I started out of high school got into the school of hard knocks selling cars, quickly realized I didn't know everything and started a quest to be the best I could be. I'm still on that quest and continue to find people that are doing the same. We sometimes do it a little different but in the end we wake up with goals of what we want to and find others like minded 'birds of a feather flock together.' Last year we started a non-profit to help homeless and veterans live better, by teaching them financing believing in themselves and arranging affordable homes for them to build equity, and increase their value. I believe we are here to make a difference, and that is what I intend to do. As I write this I just got a text from a friend of mine that said thank you for being there for me when I was ready to walk out. Another one of clients just posted how he got 3 new jobs this week from the strategies we set up 2 wks ago. I'm a results guy, I push myself to be a little better today than yesterday. When things are going great I remember Today is the Day the Lord has Made and I will Rejoice and be Glad in it. Keeping things simple and congruent is one of the rules I live by.  Studying Tony Robbins, Brian Tracy and reading hundreds of books over the years inspires me that we really are here to contribute to leave a mark and to not bury our talents in the sand. Use what you have understand there are more resources and in this day it's all about working smarter not harder. I hope to connect to you to get to know you and if there is anything I can do to help, It my purpose in life.  As a Husband and father with 5 kids and 11 grand kids now, family and time is the most important thing we all need to strive for (in the end), no one ever says I wish I would have spent more time working. I hope to hear from you and if you feel there is room for improvement I'll find it and we'll make it happen.   To your Highest Success Be Blessed! Sean Scott

Summary: Kim Wohler is the Owner and Principal Broker for Wohler Realty Group, located at Stratton Mountain, Vermont. Kim has consistently ranked as the top-producing broker in the region and #1 in the Stratton Mountain area marketplace. Her integrity, extensive knowledge, and experience with resort and second home real estate have earned her the reputation of a trusted and passionate real estate advisor. Providing superior service at all price points, on and off the mountain, Kim has a strong record of referrals and repeat clients. She has represented the 2 highest sales on Stratton Resort in its history with luxury trailside homes in Tamarack Heights selling for $3,850,000 and $3,282,500. This year at WRG, she has closed three more; County Road ($3.2M), The Mountain House (2.8M) and Starry Lane (2.44M). During 2016, Kim Wohler closed more than 30 transactions and more than 24M in volume, double her next closest competitors. Previously VCP Sotheby’s International Realty’s top producer during 2014, Kim participated in the sale of $17M in resort area real estate. Summary: Upon graduation from college, I became part of the 1996 corps of Teach For America, and taught two years of high school science at Silver Creek High School in San Jose, California. After realizing that my true passion was the emerging science of mind/body medicine, or psychoneuroimmunology, I entered the National College of Natural Medicine. After earning my Naturopathic Doctorate (N.D.), with an emphasis on classical homeopathy, I was selected for the  NCNM Family Medicine Residency Program. During this residency, I gained hundreds of extra hours of clinical training. I also participated in the OHSU Integrative Medicine Program as part of a team consisting of a chiropractor, a medical doctor, and an acupuncturist that collaborated to solve medical problems. Throughout my training and early years of private practice, I have been unsatisfied with the tools available for treating chronic disease.  I have always had a firm belief that the human body has an ability to heal itself, and that the best medicine complements and supports this ability. After five years of private practice, I developed a method of approaching the patient from a complex systems perspective that better works with the macro effects of human physiology.  Most of medicine focuses on breaking down the body into smaller and smaller pieces in hopes of increasing understanding.  My goal is to better understand the holistic nature of the interactions of emotions, spirit, the physical body, and mental health. Specialties: Chronic disease, allergies.

Summary: I practice acupuncture and western and Chinese herbal medicine at our clinic Jade Mountain Wellness in Burlington, VT. I also continue to write and teach about the connection between personal health and global sustainability, particularly with climate change, and am in the process of publishing my first book 'The Yin and Yang of Climate Change.'. The classical Chinese medical ideas and practice that promote individual well being are well suited to be applied to the cultural and environmental issues we now face. I continue advanced, post-graduate study with Jeffrey Yuen, 88th generation Taoist priest, and have completed an indepth course in oncology, including treating the underlying roots of cancer with acupuncture, herbal medicine and nutrition with Dr. Yuen. I'm also completed an advanced, 2 year Chinese herbal medicine course with Dr. Yuen, traveling to New York City one weekend monthly to study the wide-reaching, indepth history of Chinese herbal medicine and Chinese medical philosophy.  I am also on the faculty at Johnson State College in VT and at the Academy for Five Element Acupuncture in FL and teach about various aspects of natural medicine and the connection between individual health and environmental sustainability at schools and conferences nationally 'I've used Chinese Medicine as my primary form of preventative medical care for the past 25 years. Over this time, including working with practitioners in Taiwan and China, I found Brendan Kelly to be the most astute and sensitive Chinese physician that I've worked with. His understanding of theory and ability to teach others led me to invite him a number of times to my graduate classes. Vermont is indeed fortunate to have such skilled practitioner and teacher as Brendan.' Summary: With nearly two decades in the financial services and insurance industry, I have had the pleasure of assisting over a thousand clients throughout the United States. When I first started in the business, I had no idea how important my services would be to so many clients, their families and their businesses. Just a few years after I started, our nation endured 9/11, multiple wars, huge market downturns where so many lost their life savings, and years of a lackluster economy that left many unemployed. That's the bad news. During this time in my career, I have helped clients through hardship and loss of loved ones with life insurance planning that helped their children move on and pay for the college education that their parents dreamed they would receive. I have stood with those in times of need as they said goodbye to their husband or wife, father or mother, comforting them in troubled moments when they could barely think of how they would have an income now that one has moved on. I have helped protect numerous families as the markets took huge losses of close to 40%, and shown them a way to never outlive what they have worked so hard to save. Now many are living comfortably and the only complaints I hear are that the weather is too hot in their winter get-away!  Today is a complicated world, navigating it alone is not easy. The days of 'Do it yourself' life, health and retirement planning are no longer. It is not as easy as checking yourself out at Home Depot or filling your tank at the self-serve gas station. I certainly would never tell the doctor that I can do surgery on myself! Professional services are important, and that's what I offer my clients. My services are at no cost, my time is free, if I see you in person, I pay for my own gas! But what I can do for you, your family and business is invaluable! My recommendations are based on experience, my partner companies' experience, and the needs that I help uncover.  Thank you.  Scott

Summary: About Flo  Flo is a respected visionary, author, channel, healer, teacher, and spiritual mid-wife. She has worked throughout the world for 35 years with individuals and groups, guiding them to connect to and access their soul’s calling.  Through listening to and connecting with the soul, we catalyze our potential and open to inner understanding, which assists us to live our congruent vibration. Living in this vibration keeps our interactions, choices and decisions compatible with our purpose, which links us to our part of the design. This awareness is supported individually through understanding our Thought Wave Form SM a unique wave that shows how we think and pattern our responses to everything in our world. We learn what actually happens when we get “stuck,” and how to shift our perception to experience more balance and peace. Through this Accelerated Thinking Process SM profound changes are also possible for those with learning challenges, or cognitive pattern disruptions such as ADD that affect functioning and states of being. Flo trains teachers and facilitators, certifying them to offer programs that she has developed such as: Soul Recognition (SR) an ancient and shamanic journey that aligns and anchors the energy, purpose, and patterning of the soul consciously into the body and life. SR releases energetic and karmic blocks re-patterning the conditioning held in the physical, mental and emotional levels. Circuitry Alignment unifies our original blueprint within the cells and systems of our body. HeartThread is an effective yet easy way to shift long-standing physical patterns that inhibit our full health and expression.  Flo has published three books; I Remember Union: The Story of Mary Magdalena; Sunlight On Water: A Guide for Soul-full Living; and Honoring Your Child’s Spirit: Pre-Birth Bonding and Communication. Each brings a message of hope about humanity’s capacity to create a world of peace, honor, and union.

Summary: I am an educator, consultant, contractor, and author in the field of natural design and construction.  It is my objective to co-create a built environment that can transition into a carbon-smart economy, honoring values of resiliency, sustainability, access, and beauty.  I am triple-certified by Building Performance Institute (BPI) as a Building Analyst, Envelope Professional, and Healthy Homes Evaluator, a Certified Passive House Consultant (CPHC), and an Efficiency Vermont partner contractor for the Home Performance with Energy Star program. At New Frameworks, I am the Systems Designer, responsible for all enclosure details and specifications, energy modeling, and mechanical/electrical/plumbing (MEP) design and specification. I work in collaboration with Andrew Shapiro of Energy Balance to conduct thorough Net Zero Energy design modeling and analysis including dynamic building energy modeling, and conduct building performance audits, trainings, and commissioning services. My current focus has been the exploration of building materials to act as 'carbon sinks', by calculating, evaluating, and selecting materials that store more carbon than they release in their production. I am the founding and current director of the Certificate in Building Science and Net Zero Design at the Yestermorrow Design/Build School in Warren, Vermont.  I am the author of two publications, The Natural Building Companion (with Ace McArleton, Chelsea Green Press, 2012) and Essential Building Science (New Society Publishers, 2016), and present regularly in conferences such as NESEA BuildingEnergy and Efficiency Vermont's Better Buildings by Design. Specialties: Project management, owner-builder support, high-performance building systems, professional education, research, writing, building energy audits, building energy retrofits, building energy modeling, net zero energy/carbon design.

Summary: Amit Sharma has engaged in a myriad of roles that intersect financial markets, social enterprise/impact, risk management, international security, and development.  He is developing FinClusive Capital, a digital financial services platform serving the financially underserved and excluded leveraging blockchain technology, advanced analytics and global standard-based risk/compliance tools to drive financial inclusion, build economic resilience and protect financial system integrity.  Prior to FinClusive, Amit co-founded Empowerment Capital, a strategic advisory and impact investment company assisting early stage commercially scaleable social ventures.  Previously, he led Operations and Strategy for Command Global Services (CGS), managing a team of investigators, financial forensic experts, analysts and legal professionals in the recovery of stolen sovereign assets and strengthening of financial regulatory systems.  Prior to CGS, Amit was Chief of Staff and Head of New Products for Mitsubishi UFJ Securities, USA, and also Head of Project Management to the firm’s International Business and Global Markets Units.  In Washington DC, Amit served at the US Department of the Treasury, at the inception of the Office of Terrorism and Financial Intelligence—developing and implementing tools to combat transnational threats and financial crime—and later as Chief of Staff to Deputy Secretary Robert Kimmitt and part of Treasury's senior team under Secretary Henry Paulson.  He has served/serves on several working groups, advisory councils and boards, including: IntegrityRisk International, Evidencity, the Center for Sanctions and Illicit Finance (CSIF), Middlebury’s Center for Social Impact Learning (CSIL) and Georgetown University’s Beeck Center for Social Impact and Innovation. He was also a member of CGD's 2014-2015 working group on Anti-Money Laundering at the Center for Global Development.  Amit received his MBA and MA from the Monterey Institute of International Studies and his BA from The University of Virginia.

Summary: My career truly has embodied a scholar-practitioner model. My work has been published in a variety of journals and books, appearing most recently in the Oxford Handbook of Positive Organizational Scholarship, and presented at national and international conferences, including the Annual Academy of Management Meetings. I recently served as a guest editor for a special issue on positive organizational ethics for the Journal of Business Ethics.  My career, however, extends beyond the walls of academia and into practice as well. During my time at Case Western, I helped launch the Center for Business as Agent of World Benefit, which sought to highlight and foster the many ways that businesses can be a force for positive social change around the globe. I also remain very active in the Appreciative Inquiry community of practitioners, serving as a Co-Chair for past World Appreciative Inquiry Conferences held in Florida and  then Nepal, and on the Advisory Board for the conferences in Belgium and South Africa. I guest edited a special issue on advances in the AI Summit for the AI Practitioner Journal, as well as served as the co-editor for the 4th volume in the research book series Advances in Appreciative Inquiry.  I present regularly at national and international conferences, including most recently the International Positive Psychology World Congress. With a passion for helping organizations leverage their potential through strength-based change, I have consulted with a wide variety of organizations including: Green Mountain Coffee Roasters, the VTFEA, World Vision, Houston Independent School District, The California Teachers Association, Imagine Nepal, The United Nations, the American Society of Association Executives, and the Leahy Center for Lake Champlain, among others.

I’ve learned that creating order out of chaos & enabling & empowering others is my calling.  I resisted this initially, as I embarked on a career as a programmer. However, it became clear that my purpose wasn’t to develop killer code but to help other developers and teams succeed by better organizing their work & eliminating unnecessary churn.  This discovery opened the 2nd stage of my journey - learning to lead. After an unexpected departure of my manager, I was thrown into a management role which forced me to dig deep into my own capabilities and beliefs about leadership.  It wasn’t always elegant, but I eventually discovered how to provide the structure and support to help others excel.   Whether it was small projects or global teams, I’ve learned that there are three principles that are at the heart of project success: ➡️ Focus on building & nurturing the relationships that enable performance and agility ➡️ Create the climate and the structure that serves as scaffolding to success ➡️ Eliminate chaos and churn that distracts the team from it's core work This realization led to the 3rd stage in my journey - building a business focused on helping others. In 2010, I launched Newgrange IT Consulting to help clients transform their organizations by delivering their most important initiatives. I am passionate about helping clients develop a culture of delivering the right results for their organization.  We are focused on our clients’ success, so we work to align their strategy with execution.  We build strong collaborative teams to ensure that the initiative will succeed. Relentlessly curious, she is the penultimate questioner, planner and mentor at the same time. She has a high expectation of herself to add value and does so by bringing her extensive experience to the table. Annmarie's value-add is simple - she transforms.” ➡️ To see how I can help you and your team, email me at: Annmarie.Curley@NewgrangeITConsulting.com #leadership #management  #managementconsulting #Workday

Summary: Ro Morrison & Associates is a Concierge Speakers Bureau. The guiding principle I used when co-founding this business was how to make it easier for companies in Financial Services to find great speakers, coaches and industry experts to fulfill their specific business needs.  The idea is simple – a “one-stop” shop where I match your organization to the right speaker that will deliver a remarkable experience at your next event. And, it is all done for the same price as if you had called the speaker yourself. I believe that clients should get more and not have to pay when working with a speakers’ bureau.    I can’t stand the thought of world class organizations engaging a speaker who over-promises, under-delivers and jeopardizes the success and return on investment of a conference or roadshow.  It’s why I spend a lot of time getting to know the speakers I work with and passing these relationships onto my clients. It drives me crazy when an organization brings in a speaker and there is no focus on what should happen after the event. I believe speakers need to focus on key takeaways and actionable strategies. This is why I developed the RMA Speaker-Connect process which puts as much focus on the pre- and post aspects of the event, as it does on the event itself. Summary: 'Measuring is not as simple as it sounds' That's a quote from a cook book, but it's true for so many things. I can help. I am interested in working on complicated problems that have many intertwined quantitative and qualitative properties and finding actionable insights for stakeholders.  Such as modeling social systems(digital marketing/financial markets), economic markets, and the impacts of sustainable business practices on the economy/financial markets.  Very interested in GIIRS, B Analytics, SASB standards and other efforts to use measurement and data to facilitate businesses optimizing for sustainable goals. Professionally, I have an extensive experience in managing computer systems(networks, software of all types, databases, etc…).  Everything from desktop support tech to managing a 30 person IT department.  The result is I feel very comfortable working with new technologies and managing most data engineering issues.         Since 2009 I’ve been analyzing complex data sets(stochastic modeling, data mining, factor analysis, machine learning, etc…) working with Fixed Income financial data(CDO’s, Mortgage Backed Securities, Attribution, etc…), digital traffic/marketing data(Google Analytics, proprietary web metrics, digital advertising, SEO, etc…), and utility CRM data to measure the impact of marketing on energy savings. Academically, I studied complex networks and systems, stochastic differential equations, numerical methods and probability.  The result is a toolbox of quantitative methods developed for analyzing non-deterministic systems as well as knowledge and experience applying those methods with software systems(R, Matlab, SQL, Hadoop, Impala, Hive, etc...).

Summary: Dennis Reina, Ph.D. and his life and business partner, Michelle Reina, Ph.D. are the founders of Reina Trust Building®, a global consulting, assessment, coaching and development firm that has worked with leaders and teams in more than 250 organizations worldwide, and on every continent. Reina helps organizations build and rebuild trust and exceed business goals through the power of human connection, no matter the company size, structure, location or market challenges. Trust Building makes these organizations measurably more energetic, adaptive and capable.  Reina's clients include AMEX, Ben & Jerry’s, Dartmouth Hitchcock Healthcare, Harvard University, Johnson & Johnson, Lincoln Financial Group, MillerCoors, Nokia, Toyota, Turner Broadcasting, Walt Disney World, and the United States Treasury Department, to name a few. Dennis and Michelle have written two award winning, business best selling books, which have been published in multiple languages: “Trust and Betrayal in the Workplace: Building Effective Relationships in Your Organization” and “Rebuilding Trust in the Workplace: Seven Steps to Renew Confidence, Commitment, and Energy.” Their work has been featured in Bloomberg, Business Week, Harvard Management Update, The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, Time magazine, and USA Today. They have been featured on TV and radio networks, such as CNBC and CNN and have received several awards, including the World HRD Congress Global Strategic Leadership Award. In the field of organizational trust, Dennis and Michelle are pioneers. When they started consulting in 1991, Dennis and Michelle’s practice focused on how to create self-directed work teams and fix broken change efforts. While all the literature talked about how critical trust was in accomplishing those things, none of the literature gave explicit instructions on how to build trust or how to help when trust had been severed. Dennis and Michelle began a comprehensive study of trust-building, and applied their learning in organizations to build trust-fueled cultures. A particularly satisfying part of their work is how clients integrate the trust-building concepts into all aspects of life. Says Michelle: “People tell us that, not only has the company culture transformed, but so have their relationships at home. They teach the trust concepts to their family, which deepens the relationships and ends up changing lives.”
Title: Chief Trust Building® Officer | Founder

Summary: Own and operate Vermont Woods Studios, an online furniture store specializing in high-quality, eco-friendly American made furniture. We welcome interior designers, procurement specialists and homeowners interested in Vermont's sustainable, handcrafted fine furniture. Specialties include customizable office & home furniture as well as colorful Polywood outdoor furniture. We also offer Vermont's many brands of luxury home decor including Simon Pearce glassware, Hubbardton Forge lighting & Anichini linens. We build to order so customization is affordable.  Shop online, give us a call or visit our Stonehurst showroom located in a 200 year old farmhouse on a former ski resort.  I didn't plan it like this. Majored in Chemistry then got a couple masters degrees in environmental safety & health ESH.  My experience was in education & training for large corporations and government. Moving to rural Vermont meant leaving all that behind. So I decided to start my own business. I wanted to pursue my passion for forest & wildlife conservation.  My husband Ken is a woodworker. I wanted to use my experience in environmental education to reach out to people & raise awareness about the connection between forest conservation and the purchase of wood furniture & flooring.  Did you know that much of the imported furniture in the US is made from illegally harvested wood, clear-cut from the worlds rapidly disappearing rainforests?  Our mission at Vermont Woods Studios is to educate consumers about where their furniture comes from & persuade people to purchase quality furniture & flooring that are made in America from sustainably harvested wood & guaranteed to last a lifetime. Specialties: wood furniture, Polywood, outdoor furniture, American made, natural, sustainable, eco-friendly, Vermont made. Summary: CEO and Founder of Working Fields, a mission driven staffing agency providing employment opportunities to individuals with barriers due to substance use addiction, criminal convictions and other barriers. Working Fields was founded in Nov 2016 with operations beginning in early 2017.  Working Fields is an innovative solution to assist individuals with hurdles finding employment due to issues arising from substance use addiction, criminal convictions and other barriers largely associated with systemic poverty.  Working Fields works with Employers using a similar model as traditional staffing agencies by filling open positions at the Client Employer.  The  Working Fields model differs starting with the onboarding process and continues through the assignment.  The 'Associate' is supported by Working Fields with a Recovery Coach that meets weekly with the Associate while on assignment.  The Recovery Coach supports the Associate on any and all areas of a person's recovery where help is needed or simply providing support through the day to day challenges of recovery.  In addition, the Associate has an Account Manager that provides support on all things related to the assignment. With this supportive model an Associate has a greater chance of success in their job as well as their recovery.  Working Fields currently supports Employers in the Vermont counties of Chittenden, Franklin, Washington, Rutland and Addison.  Contact information can be found at www.workingfields.com

Summary: For three decades, Geri Reilly's name has been synonymous with Vermont Real Estate. You've probably heard her name before, whether it was through her regular advertisements in the Burlington Free Press, one of her informative columns about Real Estate or one of the many For Sale signs she has all over Northwestern Vermont. Chances are you know someone who has worked with, purchased or sold a home through Geri. She is a dedicated professional selling over 150 homes a year. It is Geri’s consistent, professional service that allows her to be one of the few Realtors in Vermont who is able to make the statement, 'Thousands of Homes Sold'. Geri became a Realtor shortly after graduating from the University of Vermont in 1979 and quickly became a top producer. She has been a top residential real estate agent since 1983 and top overall company salesperson from 1986 to 2008. She was Partner at Coburn and Feeley Real Estate, Inc. from 1990 to 1997. From 1997 until July 2010 she maintained her high sales performance and was the number one residential real estate producer with Coldwell Banker Hickok & Boardman Realty. She also ranked the number one Coldwell Banker agent in Vermont from 2000-2009 and was ranked within the top ten in the Northeast region. It was only natural for Geri Reilly to open her own real estate firm in 2010 after 29 years of working independently for other various firms. Her entire team followed including her husband, Mike Simoneau who heads the commercial division. Specialties: Northwestern Vermont Real Estate, residential listings, buyer brokering, agency, ethics, investments, marketing, branding and identity.
Title: Owner/Broker

Summary: With offices in Burlington, VT, Asheville, NC and Manchester, NH, White + Burke is an outsourced real estate department for businesses, institutions and municipalities. We plug in where needed to provide greater bandwidth and expand in-house skill sets, without our clients having to hire new staff.  We help develop real estate projects, prepare strategic real estate plans (asset management), do financial analyses, structure public-private partnerships, and manage community relations, allowing our clients' leadership to focus on what they do best -- running their operations.  We collaborate with other development team professionals on all aspects of the development process -- from site control through assembly of the development team, due diligence, feasibility analysis, design, permits, financing and construction.  We are specialists in permits and entitlements, including Vermont's Act 250 process. We also provide asset management services for real estate - whether a single property or a portfolio of properties.  We're deeply involved in downtown revitalization projects, including public-private partnerships. Clients include the University of Vermont Medical Center, the City of Plattsburgh, NY, IBM, the City of St. Albans, VT, Northfield Savings Bank, Onion River Food Coop, Hannaford Bros Co and the University of Vermont, among many others large and small. We also provide commercial real estate brokerage services in Vermont.
Title: President and Founder

Summary: I'm the Founder and President of The Source and Recruit Company™. We offer contingent search, retained search, and a variable-cost, demand based talent acquisition solution that leverages best-in-class process, technology, and training to recruit exceptional talent, while often reducing agency spend by 40% or more. We curate engaging advertisements that attract quality applicants, source passive talent if necessary, and use innovative tools to assess and qualify semi-finalists based on their thinking styles, behaviors, and interests, helping hiring managers improve their interviews, make objective hiring decisions, and manage hires for long-term retention.  I'm also the Founder and former Owner of Sheboygan Works, a Sheboygan, Wisconsin-based coworking space, and am an active advisor to the adventure travel software company, The Wanderlost Project.  Prior to founding The Source and Recruit Company, I was the Director of Client Services for Titus Talent Strategies where I was ranked 2nd in both sales and recruitment performance on a team of 40+ recruiters. Prior to Titus, I was a Project Management and LEED-Accredited professional and held roles in commercial construction management spanning project management, sustainable building design and construction, energy management, marketing, and business development. Beyond recruitment, I enjoy sailing, skiing, mountain biking, photography, historic preservation, and restoring vintage Land Rovers. My home base is in Rutland County, Vermont, where I'm serving as an active firefighter and emergency medical responder with the Danby/Mt. Tabor Volunteer Fire Department.

Summary: Passionate believer that business can be a force for good.  That’s why I joined Bluestone Life.  We’re a different kind of life insurance company. I’ve worked across industries and am adept at immersing myself and getting quickly to the heart of a challenge. I am a consummate communicator and collaborator.  I know how to lead and inspire teams, and how to get at the authentic core of a brand.  I'm a diplomat by nature and a music lover who regularly gets inspired by a song or a band.  I believe in the power of 'think different.'  I am a MAC who plays well with PCs. I've co-authored two books and taught at both NYU and American University.  I love the written and spoken word, and am often intoxicated by the voices of NPR as a I travel the byways of New England.  I am that person who sometimes has to pull the car over when I am overtaken by a song, an audio book or a podcast...and have had innumerable NPR “driveway moments.” I believe in joy and the power of seeing the extraordinary in the ordinary. Summary: We live in a time when change is imperative to the survival of organizations. In order to thrive in a healthy and productive manner, each and every one of us needs to be willing to deal with our own personal set of limitations and beliefs.  Organizational transformation gives us a unique opportunity to do just that. After all, most of us do not choose the people we work with or the design of the organization. But we can make it more of what we know is possible and create more freedom and joy for ourselves and those around us.  There is no straight line from point A, old culture, to point B, new culture. Culture change is a messy, time-consuming and energy-draining endeavor. It is also invigorating, exciting and endlessly rewarding. Specialties: Be more productive, alive and effective at work. Work toward high performance that allows for creativity, encouraging innovation and breakthrough thinking. Learn how to remain centered and focused during stress. Look at difficult people; bosses, co-workers, customers and peers as an opportunity to transform and learn about yourself rather then shut down or be negatively impacted. See these difficult people through a new set of choices and actions.

Summary: Working in this beautiful part of the world makes me feel like the luckiest person I know. The Northeast Kingdom of Vermont is rural, gorgeous, remote and perfect.  I've had my real estate license since 1979, and started Big Bear RE with my mom back in 1988.  She's since retired, and the Bears den now consists of this amazing family we've established in our little office.  We keep it simple and follow the Golden Rule.  What we lack in size, we make up for in service, professionalism and enthusiasm.  I find it so satisfying to help first time buyers realize the dream of home ownership, and helping someone find the perfect piece of heaven just for them and their families.  The process can be daunting, but years of experience can soften the edges and make things run smoothly. We're happy to give teddy bears at the closings to both buyers and sellers.  At Christmas time, we make our famous chocolate walnut fudge and deliver it to customers and clients along with a bear ornament.  It's a fun tradition and something we love to do.  The best compliment we can ever receive is a referral.  Over the years, it seems that we've had lots of repeat business. I'm so happy to admit that some of my favorite people and best friends started as customers and/or clients.  I've been REALTOR OF THE YEAR in 1997 and 2007 for the Orleans County Board of Realtors.  I'm the local Director for the Vermont Realtors and have been actively involved with local and state positions. In my spare time, I enjoy yoga, skiing, walking, running, riding my motorcycle, but especially enjoying the company of my family and friends.  My children have blessed me with 7 grandchildren, and they are the highlight of my world.  Family is so important.

Summary: Jack McMullen is the Managing Principal of Cambridge Meridian Group, Inc., a strategy-consulting firm that serves Fortune 500 and technology-based companies. He has worked on projects in a wide range of businesses including those in Industrial, Consumer Products, Health Care (including Medical Devices, Pharmaceuticals, Pharmaceutical Sales Management, and Genetic Engineering), Energy, Telecommunications, Software, and Internet sectors of the economy.  He has counseled presidents of client companies on strategy matters and served on the operating committees of several client companies. He also has experience in the investment banking community in New York with Morgan Stanley & Co. Incorporated  and, earlier, was an engineer with the U.S. Atomic Energy Commission.   From 1993 to 1997 he was an informal advisor to Senator Bradley (D-NJ) when the senator sought business input on crime and pension reform issues.  In 2004 he was a major party nominee for the United States Senate from Vermont. He is a Navy veteran who served on the staff of Admiral Rickover overseeing the retrofit of advanced technology reactors into the Navy’s nuclear fleet. Summary: At BUILD, Autumn works to positively impact people’s lives with inspired strategy, creative problem solving, attention to relationships, and sound data. She managed Vermont’s largest independent batterer intervention program through interdisciplinary collaborative networks with the Department of Corrections, the Department for Children and Families, and nonprofit organizations. As director of the Consumer Affairs division at the Vermont Department of Public Service, Autumn developed policy positions that balanced stakeholder needs while aligning with regulatory requirements. Autumn has brought her expertise as a professional development facilitator to state and national conferences, on a training envoy to Morocco with the U.S. Department of State, and to her own staff as a means of meeting their professional certification requirements. In both nonprofit and unionized public environments she has overhauled staff evaluation practices to turn them into an opportunity for confidence-building, personal ownership, and targeted growth. Sometimes, the best way to affect people’s lives is through improving systems, analyzing data, and creative design. With data gathered through qualitative or quantitative methods, Autumn determines what is happening, why, and what to do about it. For one project, commissioned by the State of Vermont, Autumn served as lead topical expert to research and collaboratively design new personnel policies, which have since been adopted by the state and by private employers.  Autumn enjoys a dynamic schedule that includes a private practice as a psychotherapist in addition to her work with BUILD.

Summary: I opened my first business at the age of 29 when my youngest child went into school full time. I purchased a small children's consignment shop with only 250 sq ft. I believe in a green business, and a community business. I now have over 10,000 sq ft, located in a restored turn of the century department store on Main St. in Brattleboro, Vt. When I was told it is best to 'link in' with like businesses, I could not find any, so I created them within my store. First adding adult consignment fashion, then furniture, and finally a dealer mall with multiple dealer rental space. I have over 100 dealers, who rent space in my shop for their items, creating a wide diversity of goods. I also have 3,500 consignors, who reflect the diversity of life styles and cultures, with the items they wish to sell. I find that by being a business that incorporates a large amount of different but like businesses in one location, first offers the community a place to recycle and buy recycled goods, but also an exciting place to 'find' that perfect treasure, as new stock is added daily.  Now after being in business almost 27 years, I have found a new market of clients that have an entire home to liquidate either due to a loss in the family, or a move. I now have a new business, Twice Onsite, Professional Estate & Relocation Sales. I now can put all my years in business to help clients, not only sell the contents of their home faster, but help to alleviate the stress of an emotionally charged situation. We also stage each home to help to sell the property for our clients, bringing hundreds of potential buyers to the sale. At an on site sale, we can sell anything from the low to the high with ease, unlike my store, Twice Upon A Time Antiques, which only has the capacity to sell antiques,collectible, jewelry, vintage clothing and good used furniture and decor. Twice Onsite offers this alternative to the wholesale market of auction, flea markets, and yard sales.

Summary: Jay Jacobowitz is president and founder, in 1998, of Retail Insights®, a professional consulting service providing strategic guidance to the natural products industry, and is creator of Natural Insights for Well Being®, a comprehensive consumer marketing service designed exclusively for independent natural products retailers. Retail Insights is an industry source for intelligence on the natural and organic retail space, and is cited by industry trade journals including The Wall Street Journal, Nutrition Business Journal, Natural Foods Merchandiser, and Supermarket News, among others.  For the ninth year, in March 2019, WholeFoods Magazine utilized Retail Insights’ “Retail Universe for Premium Natural, Organic Food, Supplement and Personal Care Sales,” as the definitive benchmark for the size and scope of the retail natural products industry. Retail Insights maintains a database tracking over 114,000 U.S. retail stores in eight channels selling premium natural organic products, including all major industry players, and develops a proprietary annual national index for real-estate potential for natural products demand for the strategic benefit of its clients. Consulting: Retail Insights provides a complete range of consulting services to owners of independent natural products retail stores, from strategic guidance such as store trade area location, store siting, size, and product mix; business valuation for estate planning, partnership or equity subdivision, or for the sale, merger or acquisition of business assets; and succession planning. Retail Insights also provides operational guidance on lease negotiations, wholesale vendor relationships, profit margin structure, workforce management, merchandising, and the efficient use of space.

Summary: I AM WORKING TO HELP CHANGE A CONSTRUCTION INDUSTRY STANDARD with a product that simplifies steel-to-concrete connections.  EM-BOLT boltable embed plates offer solutions to recurring construction design and installation challenges, such as thermally broken steel-to-concrete connections.      As the Business Operations Manager at EM-BOLT, I am really excited to see the this new company take off, and for our boltable embed plates to become accepted and welcomed into the construction industry.  I'm determined to overcome upcoming challenges, and am anxious to grow alongside EM-BOLT.    Jumping on board with EM-BOLT was a little intimidating at first, to be honest, but to be involved in helping launch a new business from the very beginning brings with it a huge sense of pride!  Shortly after joining the EM-BOLT team, my uneasiness faded as I realized just how revolutionary a boltable embed plate is.  It is already changing how steel-to-concrete connections are made locally, and has recently begun to gain interest on a national level.  With every connection we've made so far, - no pun intended - EM-BOLT has taken another positive turn on a very unpredicted path.  It will be very interesting to see where it will all end up! Interested in learning more about EM-BOLT and how it can save time and money on your project?   Let's connect!

Summary: Hello all, my name is Chuck Verderber of St. Albans, VT. I am a Dentist by profession, and lately, I've helped my wife, Dr. Lynda Ulrich, create an antidote to the daily news at EverWideningCircles.com. Our aim is to change the negative dialogue about our world by pointing people to all the newsworthy insight and innovation going uncelebrated in the mass media.  I come to that project with an unusual background: I started out as a kid from humble origins in a small farming town who had a knack for handling a basketball. Eventually, I became captain of the University of Kentucky basketball team and that started a global life. I played professionally in Spain, my wife and I became Irish citizens, we eventually both practiced dentistry in Italy, and then spent the rest of our lives traveling to unusual corners of the world with our 3 kids. I'm still a practicing dentist 4 days a week but my wife and I plan to spend the rest of our lives pointing people to all the wonder and innovation we can find.

Summary: Nancy Braus and Rich Geidel started Everyone’s Books on Elliot Street in 1984. They are both long-time peace and anti-nuclear activists who’ve had previous bookstore experience. They felt that there were many books and other materials that were difficult to find in the increasingly chain-store environment, and this is truer now than ever. Nancy feels fortunate to be working at a job that promotes peace, environmental awareness, and political change. She loves hiking, biking and cross country skiing. She reads fiction, memoir, and lots of children’s and young adult books. She and their daughter Molly Geidel authored Everyone’s Kid’s Books, an annotated guide to kids books for all kinds of children. Nancy also sells books at human services and education conferences throughout the Northeast, as well as conferences promoting peace and progressive social change. She can fulfil and supplement your required reading lists. She would be happy to put together a book fair for your event and split the profits with organizers who sell the books. E-mail or call her for more information. Rich enjoys bicycling to work and home from Putney, fixing things and of course, reading. He is a supporter of international grass-roots movements for social justice and the environment. Specialties: We’re a family owned independent bookstore specializing in books about social change, the environment, and multicultural children’s books. Many of our books are by original, creative, and progressive authors.

Summary: At the Sustainable Business, we know you want to have a well-oiled machine. You want to have employees taking responsibility for their work, engaged and happy customers, and make tons of money. You also want to once again have fun at work and be with people whom you consider your friends. In order to do this, you need to have a sale-ready company. This is a company that others would want to own and there's a better than even chance you have no interest in selling. Here's the challenge with this: It's really hard to run a great business where all of the above happens. Often, it seems like everything is just plainly working against you.  We believe it's not fair that you work so hard and get results (financially and emotionally) that are far less than what you want.  We understand how that feels. I've been there are way too many times I've felt the weight of the world is on my shoulders and there's no one around to help. This is why over 40 years ago I made it my mission to find simple ways to overcome those issues. Here's how we help blue-collar business owners like you: 1. The first step is find out what you want and why. We call this the alignment conversation. You'll learn what it is you want and what the gap is between where you are and what you want. 2. We only work on one thing at a time. Almost every business owner we know has a laundry list of strategic activities they want to be accomplished. We know that if there is one or two, none of them will ever get done. 3. We focus, focus, focus on those one or two things get them to the point of being done, then tackle the next thing on the list. So, the most important thing you can do to help you stay out of the weeds and figure out what you really want is to have a short conversation with us. Just use this link to set a time and date for us to talk. https://calendly.com/jpatrick/twenty-minute-free-call And, if you're not ready to talk, just yet. Get our free eBook on our Objective Review. This will outline the steps we think you should go through to create a personally and economically sustainable business. https://www.stage2planning.com/objective-review-white-paper After your conversation with us, you'll understand what you need to do to avoid burnout and instead once again love your work and company and have tons and tons of energy.

Summary: I am a planner at heart and a teacher in my soul.   Nicknamed 'The Question Queen' by coworkers and clients alike, I am at my most passionate and impactful when there are problems to be solved and teams to be mobilized. Project Management provides the structure I need to tackle complex problems and I believe that everyone should have access to the powerful tools and tactics to overcome their obstacles to growth.  As a consultant, I know that it always comes back to you, your needs, and your priorities. Which is why when I founded my first company in July 2019, I chose “Echo” Consulting. The thing about an echo, is that it always comes back to you! Projects are meant to be temporary, but your success shouldn't be. That is why my recommended approach is adoption focused. Too many companies focus on picking the “right” or “best” tool or process, but struggle with the communication, change management, and adoption strategies to truly maximize the value. One of the many ways I stand out is I am not interested in relying on client dependency to grow. My goal is to build self-sufficiency, nurture champions on your team, and grow together as a community and world. Or to paraphrase one of my favorite Economics professors, sometimes to get a larger slice of pie its better to help bake a bigger pie.

Summary: A.  QTGuard.   AI driven, hand-held, device offering safety, convenience and reassurance to patients* on QT prolonging therapy. (*and their doctors). For under $100.  Screening and monitoring of QT interval, heart rhythm and sounds without training, at home, clinic, hospital,  underserved and remote areas, drug trials. No training required. Our core research and the COVID pandemic led to a new project (in course): AI driven, simple, hand held, automatic QT interval measuring device.  It is sterilizable, reusable and fully autonomous, not requiring any external input. All analytics on users smart phone.   No training required.  In addition to use with hydroxychloroquine and azithromycin, the device can screen and monitor patients on over 200 other drugs with the potential for life-threatening arrhythmias due to QT interval prolongation.  Other applications include use in new drug studies, because QT monitoring is now required in all such studies.   B.  Our  REMmedy platform uses Recurrent Neural Networks and wearable sensors to accurately and reproducibly, in real time detect desired physiologic states and subsequently reproduce them using conditioned triggers.  AI 'Sleeping Pill'.   As easy to use as a pill BUT non-addictive and without side effects. A. Significant improvement in mood, energy, wellbeing, job satisfaction and willingness to travel. Next:   1.   AI 'Pain Pill' Reducing opiate use and probability of opiate dependance in post-surgical pain management.   2.   AI Situational 'Anxiety Pill',  social and performance anxiety management.

Summary: Hey, let me ask you something... Why would someone buy your CBD products over all the others? Maybe because it’s organic, full-spectrum, or you have some nice packaging? Perhaps a slick website or a compelling founder’s story? The thing is, most other CBD brands have those things too. And with over 3,000 CBD companies competing for attention, your brand ends up looking the same. That means every day you're losing money because your CBD products are drowning in a sea of look-alikes. Don't get me wrong...unique product features and packaging are great, but they don’t help you stand out or make people feel connected to your brand.  And connecting with people so they feel like they know you is the best way to separate your products. You see, studies show that emotionally connected customers are more than TWICE as valuable as highly satisfied customers. Crazy, right? So what's the best way to connect with CBD customers? Well, by using the most direct, personal, and compliant channel you have - email. Engaging emails build know/like/trust and will boost your revenue by 20-40% percent. Sounds great, right? But that little voice is telling you it’s not that easy. How do you actually make email marketing return such awesome results?  You could try… ❌ Dazzling subscribers with more hi-res images. ❌ Bribing them with 25% discounts every 72 hours. ❌ Cramming more CTAs into every email. Nah, you can do better. Old school emails don’t cut it anymore. People don’t want ads in their inbox. You need emails that... ✅ Stand out from the garbage (and even the good stuff) in someone’s inbox. ✅ Hook readers with personality that makes them excited to open, click and buy. ✅ Break the downward spiral of needing to offer bigger and bigger discounts. You can do this, and it will change your CBD business. You'll start turning casual shoppers into long time customers. Check this out...  Here’s a customer’s response to an email I wrote for a client: “Love this! Love your message! LOVE your products! Thanks for doing what you do! I can completely relate!” Would you like to send emails that create raving fans like that? Wouldn’t it be great if I showed you how? Well, I’d be happy to! Just shoot me a message here on LinkedIn. Or… Email me: justin@heymakers.io Grab a time to talk: https://www.heymakers.io/contact

Summary: Throughout his career, Jim has been in the forefront of implementing new technology and processes to improve productivity and profitability for his firm and its clients.   This philosophy fits neatly into today's concept of Design Thinking a problem solving program based on empathetically understanding one's customers, defining and solving their problems, and implementing and refining the solutions.
